title: Rob Elloway
text:
Rob Elloway (born 9 November 1983) is a former <a href="Germany">German</a> <a href="List%20of%20Germany%20national%20rugby%20union%20players">international</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, playing for the <a href="Cornish%20Pirates">Cornish Pirates</a> in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> and the <a href="Germany%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">German rugby team</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Rinteln">Rinteln</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>, he has played rugby since 1990. He was born on a <a href="British%20Forces%20Germany">British Army</a> base in Germany to an English father and a German mother, thereby qualifying to play for Germany.
Elloway, from a rugby playing family, his father Kevin Elloway, a <a href="Royal%20Engineers">Royal Engineers</a>, represented his corps at rugby. He was educated at <a href="Sedbergh%20School">Sedbergh School</a> and played junior rugby at <a href="Sedgley%20Park%20R.U.F.C.">Sedgley Park</a>. Elloway made a number of appearances for <a href="Gloucester%20Rugby">Gloucester Rugby</a>, spent some time at <a href="Pertemps%20Bees">Pertemps Bees</a> on loan in the 2006–07 season before joining the <a href="Cornish%20Pirates">Cornish Pirates</a> in 2007.
He made his debut for Germany against <a href="Russia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Russia</a> on 2 May 2009.
